newsitem.title: BRAZIL: BNDES sees power sector dominating Brazil selloffs.
newsitem.headline: BNDES sees power sector dominating Brazil selloffs.

text.p: Brazil's power sector will dominate privatizations in 1997, the head of the National Development Bank (BNDES) Luiz Carlos Mendonca de Barros was quoted as saying.

Mendonca de Barros told O Globo newspaper in a interview that BNDES has already spent 1.1 billion reais to encourage states to privatize by allowing them to receive in advance revenues from the privatization of their power utilities before the selloff takes place.
"We have paid in advance part of the resources they will raise with the privatizations," he was quoted as saying.
So far BNDES has granted funds to states of Minas Gerais, Rio de Janeiro and Bahia, which control power utilities Cerj, Cemig, Copel and Coelba, the newspaper said.
